TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit JsonDocumentOptions extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides the ability for the user to define custom behavior when parsing JSON to create a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
For more information, see [How to serialize and deserialize JSON](/dotnet/standard/serialization/system-text-json-how-to).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowTrailingCommas { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.AllowTrailingCommas : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an extra comma at the end of a list of JSON values in an object or array is allowed (and ignored) within the JSON payload being read.
Docs.value: if an extra comma at the end of a list of JSON values in an object or array is allowed; otherwise, . Default is

remarks.format:
## Remarks
By default, `AllowTrailingCommas` is set to `false`, and a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException> is thrown if a trailing comma is encountered.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Text::Json::JsonCommentHandling CommentHandling { System::Text::Json::JsonCommentHandling get(); void set(System::Text::Json::JsonCommentHandling value); };
member this.CommentHandling : System.Text.Json.JsonCommentHandling with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how the handles comments when reading through the JSON data.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that indicates how comments are handled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
By default, a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException> is thrown if a comment is encountered.

Docs.exception: The comment handling enum is set to a value that is not supported (or not within the enum range).

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxDepth { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxDepth : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when parsing JSON data, with the default (that is, 0) indicating a maximum depth of 64.
Docs.value: The maximum depth allowed when parsing JSON data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Parsing past this depth will throw a <xref:System.Text.Json.JsonException>.

Docs.exception: The max depth is set to a negative value.
